DOC.HEAD: 33 Killed In Two South Africa Bus Accidents
DOC.TEXT: A bus carrying gold miners home for the holidays overturned, and another bus caught fire while most of its passengers slept, police said Saturday. At least 33 people died in the incidents. Twenty-two people died in the fire, which broke out Friday night on a bus that stopped along a highway near the central city of Bloemfontein because of mechanical problems. The bus carried 95 passengers. Eleven men were killed and 20 injured when a bus carrying miners to the black homeland of Transkei overturned in southern Natal province, police said.
